desc: - Features Python books, resources, news and articles.

desc: - Resources for reporting bugs, accessing the Python source tree with CVS and taking part in the development of Python.

desc: - Scripts, examples and news about Python programming for the Windows platform.

desc: - News and information related to Python and its promotion as "most powerful language you can still read."

title: Anand Pillai -  Random bytes on technology and open source
Blended Technologies
desc: - Programming weblog for a small, newly formed, and curious company; covers mostly Python.

title: Gruet, Richard
desc: - Python Language Quick Reference versions 1.5 to 2.3. OmniORBpy utilities and other Python stuff.

title: Hinsen, Konrad
desc: - Python for science. In particular computational chemistry.

title: Kuchling, A.M.
desc: - Lots of Python code and information, several quotation collections, and a Robertson Davies page.

title: Learning Python
desc: - A weblog tracking one man's journey into Python.

title: Lundh, Fredrik
desc: - Personal guide to libraries, modules and extensions. Includes a weblog with Python news and personal ramblings.

title: Norlanders, Oscar
desc: - Blog about programming. TeX bibliography tweak. Resume. Links.

title: van Rossum, Guido
desc: - Personal home page of the creator of the Python programming language.

title: Computers: Programming: FAQs, Help, and Tutorials
Computers: Programming: Languages: Python: Articles and Reviews
Python Documentation Index
desc: - Official tutorial and references, including library/module usage, Macintosh libraries, language syntax, extending/embedding, and the Python/C API. Also links to off-site beginners' tutorials, HOWTOs, and many special interest topics.

title: About.com: Python
desc: - Includes articles on simple script solutions, database management, web development, network protocols, and other advanced topics.

title: A Beginner's Python Tutorial
desc: - A Python tutorial originally written for the modding community of Firaxis' Civilization. Useful to beginners with little or no programming knowledge.

title: Cameron Laird on Python and the Web
desc: - Discusses both client-side and server-side Web programming.

title: Code Like a Pythonista: Idiomatic Python
desc: - A tutorial that teaches common Python programming idioms used by experienced programmers, but may not be obvious to newcomers.

title: A Course in Python/CGI
desc: - This site contains materials from a 13 week course for learning Python and CGI. Suited for self-study.

title: The Django Book
desc: - Free (Only E-Book version) Django Web Framework E-Book by APress. The best book for learning Django. Requires good understanding of Python.

title: Five Minutes to a Python CGI
desc: - By David Mertz. Brief introduction to writing CGI programs, Python CGI module, formatting output, error logging/debugging.

title: Instant Hacking
desc: - By Magnus Lie Hetland. Minimal, concise, general introduction to programming, via Python, moves very quickly. English, Italian, Polish, Japanese, Serbian, Korean.

title: Instant Python
desc: - By Magnus Lie Hetland. Minimal introduction for experienced programmers. Treats basics, OO programming, Jedi mind trick. English, French, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish; German, Norwegian; Lithuanian, Polish, Russian; Japanese, Korean.

title: One Day of IDLE Toying
desc: - By Danny Yoo. Visual guide to using IDLE, a simple interactive shell for Python programming. Each step of this tutorial has screenshots for absolute beginners. English, Dutch, German; Greek, French, Italian, Portuguese; Indonesian.

title: Python and UML
desc: - Can the UML help Python developers? How about CP4E?

title: Python Database Programming
desc: - Programs can use minimal code to access, display, and update a database. This guide provides "links to relevant Python modules, documentation, and projects" concerning databases, as well as adding persistence to Python objects.

title: Python for Beginners
desc: - New to programming? This page lists some places that can get you started quickly.

title: Python Programming for Beginners
desc: - Shows how to write programs that use command-line options, read and write to pipes, access environment variables, handle interrupts, read from and write to files, create temporary files, write to system logs.

title: Python Programming Tutorial
desc: - By Richard G. Baldwin. Separate lessons teach programming basics. Free online, fee download files.

title: Python Quick Reference
desc: - By Simon Brunning. Thorough 'cheat sheet'; brief reminders for nearly each language aspect: syntax nuances; built-in features, statements, modules; basic, advanced types, operations; lexical entities, common development tools. For several Python versions; HTML, Zip, Windows Help, text.

title: Python Recipes
desc: - Collaborative website built by ActiveState and O'Reilly, hosts user contributions; collection of recipes.

title: Python SIGs
desc: - Archives of current and past listserv discussions on a LOT of interesting topics. GREAT for researching problems.

title: Python Tutorial
desc: - Introduction to Python, where to find it, how to install, and create a very simple script.

title: A Quick Tour of Python
desc: - Short overview of some basics, for users with some programming knowledge.

title: TCC Publications: Programming Languages
desc: - Python language quick reference (28 pp),  Tkinter reference (84 pp),  Python Imaging Library PIL quick reference (6 pp). Postscript and PDF formats available.

title: Tutorialized.com - Free Python tutorials
desc: - A collection of Python tutorials from resources around the Internet.

title: Wikibooks Programming Python
desc: - A tutorial for python on Wikibooks. It is editable by anyone.

title: Writing CGI Programs in Python
desc: - Introduces using Python for CGI applications. Has database access examples. Several parts. [Developer Shed]

title: BayPIGgies
desc: - The Silicon Valley-San Francisco Bay Area Python Users Group.

title: Chicago Python User Group
desc: - Meetings, book reviews and mailing list.

title: Clepy
desc: - A group of Python enthusiasts living in the Cleveland, Ohio, area.

title: Dallas Ft. Worth Pythoneers
desc: - Offers mailing list, a source repository and member profiles.

title: Fredericksburg ZPUG
desc: - Fredericksburg Zope and Python Users Group.

title: FRPythoneers
desc: - A Python user group in the Fort Collins area that meets in Broomfield, CO.

title: The GrimPypers
desc: - A group of Python users, programmers and enthusiasts based in Grimstad, Norway.

title: Omaha Python Users Group
desc: - A Python users group in the Omaha, NE Metro area.

title: OPAG
desc: - Ottawa Python Authors Group. A group devoted to learning, using and providing resources for Python. OPAG also serves as a general gathering place for Python programmers from the Ottawa region and beyond.

title: PyGTA
desc: - The Toronto Python/Zope User Group meets regularly to explore the expanding world of Python and Zope.

title: TriZPUG
desc: - he Triangle Zope/Python User Group in the Raleigh-Durham-Chapel Hill area of North Carolina, USA.

title: Utah Python User Group
desc: - Offers meeting information, mailing list and links to members' blogs.

title: Core Python Programming
desc: - By Wesley J. Chun; Prentice Hall PTR, 2001, ISBN 0130260363. For experienced developers to improve extant skills; professional level examples. Starts by introducing syntax, objects, error handling, functions, classes, built-ins. [Prentice Hall]

title: Data Structures and Algorithms with Object-Oriented Design Patterns in Python
desc:
- The primary goal of this book is to promote object-oriented design using Python and to illustrate the use of the emerging object-oriented design patterns.
A secondary goal of the book is to present mathematical tools just in time. Analysis techniques and proofs are presented as needed and in the proper context.

title: Dive Into Python 3
desc: - By Mark Pilgrim, Guide to Python 3  and its differences from Python 2. Each chapter starts with a real code sample and explains it fully. Has a comprehensive appendix of all the syntactic and semantic changes in Python 3

title: Foundations of Python Network Programming
desc: - This book covers a wide range of topics. From raw TCP and UDP to encryption with TSL, and then to HTTP, SMTP, POP, IMAP, and ssh. It gives you a good understanding of each field and how to do everything on the network with Python.

title: FreeTechBooks: Python Scripting Language
desc: - Annotated list of free online books on Python scripting language. Topics range from beginner to advanced.

title: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist: Learning with Python
desc: - By Allen B. Downey, Jeffrey Elkner, Chris Meyers; Green Tea Press, 2002, ISBN 0971677506. Teaches general principles of programming, via Python as subject language. Thorough, in-depth approach to many basic and intermediate programming topics. Full text online and downloads: HTML, PDF, PS, LaTeX. [Free, Green Tea Press]

title: An Introduction to Python
desc: - By Guido van Rossum, Fred L. Drake, Jr.; Network Theory Ltd., 2003, ISBN 0954161769. Printed edition of official tutorial, for v2.x, from Python.org. [Network Theory, online]

title: Learn to Program Using Python
desc: - Book by Alan Gauld with full text online. Introduction for those learning programming basics: terminology, concepts, methods to write code. Assumes no prior knowledge but basic computer skills.

title: Making Use of Python
desc: - By Rashi Gupta; John Wiley and Sons, 2002, ISBN 0471219754. Covers language basics, use for CGI scripting, GUI development, network programming; shows why it is one of more sophisticated of popular scripting languages. [Wiley]

title: Practical Python
desc: - By Magnus Lie Hetland; Apress LP, 2002, ISBN 1590590066. Readable guide to ideas most vital to new users, from basics common to high level languages, to more specific aspects, to a series of 10 ever more complex programs. [Apress]

title: Pro Python System Administration
desc: - By Rytis Sileika, ISBN13: 978-1-4302-2605-5, Uses real-world system administration examples like manage devices with SNMP and SOAP, build a distributed monitoring system, manage web applications and parse complex log files, monitor and manage MySQL databases.

title: Programming in Python 3 (Second Edition)
desc: - A Complete Introduction to the Python 3.

title: Python 2.1 Bible
desc: - By Dave Brueck, Stephen Tanner; John Wiley and Sons, 2001, ISBN 0764548077. Full coverage, clear explanations, hands-on examples, full language reference; shows step by step how to use components, assemble them, form full-featured programs. [John Wiley and Sons]

title: Python 3 Object Oriented Programming
desc: - A step-by-step tutorial for OOP in Python 3, including discussion and examples of abstraction, encapsulation, information hiding, and raise, handle, define, and manipulate exceptions.

title: Python Language Reference Manual
desc: - By Guido van Rossum, Fred L. Drake, Jr.; Network Theory Ltd., 2003, ISBN 0954161785. Printed edition of official language reference, for v2.x, from Python.org, describes syntax, built-in datatypes. [Network Theory, online]

title: Python Programming Patterns
desc: - By Thomas W. Christopher; Prentice Hall PTR, 2002, ISBN 0130409561. Shows how to write large programs, introduces powerful design patterns that deliver high levels of robustness, scalability, reuse.

title: Python Programming with the Java Class Libraries: A Tutorial for Building Web and Enterprise Applications with Jython
desc: - By Richard Hightower; Addison-Wesley, 2002, 0201616165. Begins with Python basics, many exercises, interactive sessions. Shows programming novices concepts and practical methods. Shows programming experts Python's abilities and ways to interface with Java APIs. [publisher website]

title: Python: Visual QuickStart Guide
desc: - By Chris Fehily; Peachpit Press, 2002, ISBN 0201748843. Task-based, step-by-step visual reference guide, many screen shots, for courses in digital graphics; Web design, scripting, development; multimedia, page layout, office tools, operating systems. [Prentice Hall]

title: Sams Teach Yourself Python in 24 Hours
desc: - By Ivan Van Laningham; Sams Publishing, 2000, ISBN 0672317354. Split into 24 hands-on, 1 hour lessons; steps needed to learn topic: syntax, language features, OO design and programming, GUIs (Tkinter), system administration, CGI. [Sams Publishing]

title: Text Processing in Python
desc: - By David Mertz; Addison Wesley. Book in progress, full text, ASCII format. Asks for feedback. [author website, Gnosis Software, Inc.]

title: XML Processing with Python
desc: - By Sean McGrath; Prentice Hall PTR, 2000, ISBN 0130211192, has CD-ROM. Methods to build XML applications fast, Python tutorial, DOM and SAX, new Pyxie open source XML processing library. [Prentice Hall PTR]

title: Charming Python
desc: - Column by David Mertz, Gnosis Software, Inc. Over 20 articles on Python programming, many topics.

title: Developing GNOME Application with Python
desc: - Set of articles written for beginners in Gnome programming and GNU/Linux.

title: An Interview with Guido van Rossum
desc: - Python creator discusses features and future of the language. O'Reilly Media.

title: Mark Lutz's Python Advocacy Page
desc: - Links to several old Python articles and reviews.

title: Python Enhancement Proposals (PEPs)
desc: - Design documents providing information to the Python community, or describing a new feature for Python.

title: Python Programming Language
desc: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

title: Python Squeezes the Web
desc: - A practical example of using Python to automate the crawl of web pages.

title: SOA and Web Services
desc: - Several articles related to the development of web services with Python, written by Mike Olson and Uche Ogbuji, 2001-2004. IBM developerWorks.

title: Interview of Guido van Rossum
desc:
- Interview of the BDFL by the visitors of a French Linux news portal (the English version is included).
                                 (March 12, 2003)

title: A Conversation with Guido van Rossum
desc:
- Python creator talks with Bill Venners about topics relevant to Python and its community; 6 part series, Artima Software.
                                 (February 17, 2003)

title: Proper XML Output in Python
desc:
- Uche Ogbuji explores the intricacies of creating proper XML output in Python, including character set and encoding issues.
                                 (November 13, 2002)

title: Python Persistence Management
desc:
- Using serialization to store Python objects.
                                 (November 01, 2002)

title: A Tour of 4Suite
desc:
- In this installment of Python and XML, Uche Ogbuji provides a tour of the core XML processing facilities of 4Suite.
                                 (October 16, 2002)

title: Make Python Run as Fast as C with Psyco
desc:
- Using psyco, the python specializing compiler.
                                 (October 01, 2002)

title: Simplified Exception Identification in Python
desc:
- Using functions and exception pattern dictionaries to simplify error recovery.
                                 (July 28, 2002)

title: Pick Up Some Python with This Script Walk-through
desc:
- An example conversion of a Perl script to Python.
                                 (June 18, 2002)

title: Space Shuttle Engineers Use Python to Streamline Mission Design
desc:
- Description of a practical use of Python by NASA, with quotes of Robin Friedrich, USA's Senior Project Engineer.
                                 (June 17, 2002)

title: Python: Yes, You Should Be Using It!
desc:
- Alex Martelli gives an overview of the possibilities offered by Python, along with samples allowing the newcomer to experience Python code. [Free registration required to view this article.]
                                 (April 01, 2002)

title: Using Mix-ins with Python
desc:
- An explanation of the mix-in programming style as applied in Python.
                                 (April 01, 2001)

title: Embedding Python in Multi-Threaded C/C++ Applications
desc:
- A Linux Magazine article featuring an overview of the C/C++ API, explaining how to extend and embed Python in a multi-thread context.
                                 (May 01, 2000)

title: Why Python?
desc:
- Article by Eric Raymond where he explains reasons that led him to switch from Perl to Python.
                                 (May 01, 2000)

title: Linux Journal Python Interview
desc:
- An Interview with Guido van Rossum. A conversation with the creator of Python about an effort to teach Python to non-computer science students.
                                 (September 28, 1999)

title: CPython
desc: - The original implementation of Python, written in C.

title: IronPython
desc: - A fast Python implementation for .NET and Mono.

title: Jython
desc: - A 100 % Pure Java implementation of the Python language.

title: Python for .NET
desc: - Package gives nearly seamless integration with .NET Common Language Runtime: CLR. Strong scripting tool, allows scripting or building full programs in Python, using .NET services and components coded in any language targeting CLR: Managed C++, C#, VB, JScript.

title: Stackless Python
desc: - An experimental implementation that supports continuations, generators, microthreads, and coroutines.

title: Hap Python Remote Debugger
desc: - A remote debugger and IDE that can also be used for local debugging.

title: IPython
desc: - An enhanced interactive Python shell with many features for object introspection, system shell access, and its own special command system for adding functionality when working interactively. [Open Source, LGPL]

title: PyCrust - The Flakiest Python Shell
desc: - An interactive, graphical Python shell written in Python using wxPython.

title: Pymerase
desc: - A tool intended to generate a python object model, relational database, and an object-relational model connecting the two using UML or XML. However, it has been extended to also output GUI widgets and can be easily extended to output whatever else you might like. [Open source, MIT License]

title: PyReverse
desc: - A set of tools for reverse engineering Python code, including creation of files readable by ArgoUML. Project information, downloads, and bug-track details. [Open Source, GPL]

title: Tixapps Applications Framework
desc: - Tixapps applications are a suite of development applications that run with  Tk/Tcl or Python, using the Tix widget set. [Open Source, BSD-like]

title: Winpdb
desc: - An advanced python debugger, with support for smart breakpoints, multiple threads, namespace modification, embedded debugging and encrypted communication.

title: config
desc: - Module allows implement a hierarchical configuration scheme for Python applications.

title: ExpectPy
desc: - An extension for a Python-feel to the Expect library. [Open Source, LGPL]

title: Grouch
desc: - Web development related open source software packages developed by MEMS and Nanotechnology Exchange. [Open Source, Python license]

title: log4p
desc: - The Logging Toolkit For Python, modeled after the Java toolkit log4j. [Open Source, IBM Public License]

desc: - The eGenix.com mx Extensions for Python are a collection of professional quality Python software tools which enhance Python's usability in many important areas such as ODBC database connectivity, fast text processing, date/time processing and web site programming.

title: Orange
desc: - A free, component-based, public domain data mining software, which includes a range of preprocessing, modelling and data exploration techniques. [Open Source, GPL]

title: Parallel Python
desc: - Provides an open source module to allow parallel execution of code on systems with multiple processors and on clusters. Features list, documentation, download, code samples, and a discussion forum.

title: Sisyphus
desc: - A module that simplifies running Python stuff as cron jobs. [Open Source, Python license]

desc: - Contains the following parts: Object Library, IO/Timers, Threads, Inter-Process/Distributed Communication. [Open Source, GPL]

desc: - NIAL, Nested Interactive Array Language, mixes aspects of functional array and procedural languages. Rich primitives set makes it easy, fast to code loop-free data-driven algorithms. Also Q'Nial IDE, and Nial Data Engine embeddable interpreter. [Open Source, Artistic Licence]

title: An Object Model for Multiparadigm Programming
Piccola: A Small Composition Language
desc: - PI based COmposition LAnguage: research language to explore the paradigm: Application = Components + Scripts. From the University of Berne.

title: ResearchIndex: From Competition to Amalgamation of Different Programming Paradigms
desc: - Describes basic elements (data, actions, tunings, voids, mixtures, ...) and principles of programming (stratification, implicit knowledge, limited freedom, ...), directed to amalgamating different programming paradigms (imperative, object-oriented, functional, constraint, ...) in a unified process of generating computer system models.

title: Scala
desc: - General purpose language; multiparadigm (object-oriented, functional, concurrent elements); statically typed, type-safe; focus: Web services. Successor of Funnel. Interoperates with Java VM or .NET, XML aware. [Open source, BSD-like license]

title: X Language: xlang
desc: - The eXtensible Language: easy to use, multi-syntax, portable set of APIs to create CLI and GUI applications for Unix/X11 and Win32; will ease making big applications, has interpreter/compiler/debugger. [Open Source, GPL]

title: XLR: Extensible Language and Runtime
desc: - XL is designed to implement the ideas of Concept Programming. It can apply to many domains and problem spaces, not only a small subset of the problems users must solve.

title: Heron: Introducing The Heron Programming Language
Licensing .Net Pro
desc: - Software license management for .Net software and components. Provides software encryption and source code obsfucation.

title: Nemerle
desc: - A hybrid (functional, object-oriented and imperative) programming language for the .NET platform. It is statically typed, has metaprogramming capabilities and is specifically designed for programmers with C#/Java background. [Open source, BSD-like license]

title: Science: Math: Logic and Foundations: Computational Logic
Science: Math: Logic and Foundations: Proof Theory
Science: Math: Logic and Foundations: Software
Science: Social Sciences: Linguistics: Languages: Constructed: Logical
Axiomatic Language
desc: - A pure, minimal but extensible, logic-programming/specification language with meta-language capability is described. The paradigm involved explicitly separates declarative specification from ensuing transformation.

title: COMPULOG NET: Network of Excellence: NoE
desc: - Information on European ESPRIT Basic Research (funded) NoE, concerned with computational logic. Large community of European researchers, over 80 nodes at leading universities, businesses.

title: DBLP: Logic Programming
desc: - A bibliography on logic programming is supplemented with a survey of conferences, journals, series of books, organizations and related subjects.

title: Imperial College London: Logic and Artificial Intelligence
desc: - Department of Computing, Imperial College of Science, Technology and Medicine, University of London: research group on logic and artificial intelligence focusing on communicating agents, computational logic and computational bioinformatics. Faculty home pages and departmental technical reports provide documentation on (the evolution) of logic programming.

title: KLIC Association
desc: - Develops and popularizes KLIC implementation of concurrent and parallel logic programming language KL1, and related software. Designed in the Fifth Generation Computer Systems (FGCS) project, by Institute for New Generation Computer Technology (ICOT), Japan. Free software.

title: Logic-Based Systems Lab
desc: - Department of Computer and Information Science, Brooklyn College of the City University of New York. Home of the 2LP Language, runs on Linux, RS6000, SGI, Solaris, SunOS, Windows; download yours now. Free. Cool logo.

title: LPNMR Conferences
desc: - Conferences of the Special Interest Group on Logic Programming and Non-Monotonic Reasoning.

title: The Maude System
desc: - Maude is a reflective language based on equational rewrite principles, useful for modeling and solving a wide range of computational problems.

title: PC AI - Logic Programming
desc: - As part of a survey of information on artificial intelligence this section on logic programming is provided.

title: SampleTalk Language and Programming Technology
desc: - AI language simpler than Prolog, based on generalization and matching of unconstrained text processing samples and allowing a program to be built immediately from data-processing examples.

title: Toontalk
desc: - Visual, animated programming language for kids combining concurrent and constraint logic programming with target programs roughly compatible with Oz, E-Lang, Janus, Flat Guarded Horn Clauses,  KL1/KLIC, Flat Concurrent Prolog, Parlog and Strand.

title: TyRuBa
desc: - Type Rule Base is an experimental logic/metaprogramming language for generating Java code. This BSD-licensed free software resembles Prolog, is implemented in Java and provides a simple command-line interface.

title: The World Wide Web Virtual Library: Logic Programming
desc: - Affiliated with the comp.lang.prolog newsgroup this repository includes general information, Prolog, Window system interfaces, other logic-programming systems, meetings, books and related information.

title: Xcerpt
desc: - A logic-based query and transformation language for XML and semistructured data.

title: XE
desc: - Resulting from the Exbed project, this general-purpose programming language supports data abstraction and rule-based programming and is based on but is not a formal extension of CLU.

title: XSB
desc: - A research-oriented Logic Programming system for Unix and Windows/DOS-based systems, representing a semantically enriched functional superset of Prolog and offering among other things evaluation through full SLG resolution.

title: Matchmaker, MACH Interface Generator (MIG)
desc: - Automated generation of multilingual interprocess communication interfaces. Abstract and PS/DOC files.

title: Digital Core Design
desc: - VHDL, Verilog synthesizable and simulation models.

title: Doulos KnowHow
desc: - Designer's guides and models for VHDL and Verilog. SystemC home. Also Perl and Tcl/Tk for hardware designers resources.

title: HDL at Wikipedia
desc: - Definitions, resources, and links related to hardware description languages.

title: Ruby
desc: - Ruby is a notation and design discipline intended for the development of regular integrated circuits and similar hardware and software architectures.

title: Computers: Programming: Languages: Ada: Operating Systems
BRiX: Advanced Computing Environment
desc: - Fast, no-kernel, single address space, data-centric, preemptive multithreaded, persistent, secure, multi-user operating system, with Crush function-based programming safe-language. Some code available. [Open Source, Artistic]

title: BRiX: SourceForge
desc: - Fast, single privilege, single address space, preemptive multithreaded, persistent, data-centric, secure, multiuser OS, with safe language, reconfigurable graphical interface.

title: Choices Object-Oriented Operating System
desc: - Research OS coded in C++, architecture organized as frameworks of objects hierarchically classed by function, performance; customized by replacing subframeworks, objects; application interface is kernel objects exported via application/kernel protection layer; kernel and application objects examined via application browsers; runs on bare hardware on distributed and parallel computers. Virtual Choices (VChoices) also runs under Unix System V.

title: Crush/BRiX: An Experimental Language/OS Pair
desc:
- The usual variety of lively opinions, some of which are informed by study and quite insightful and useful in further understanding BRiX. [Slashdot]
                                 (August 18, 2002)

title: Computers: Programming: Languages: Comparison and Review
Frink
desc: - A programming language and calculating tool. It tracks units of measure through all calculations, and helps to get the answers right.

title: Gema
desc: - Home of the GEneral purpose MAcro processor tool, with a binding for the Lua scripting language, named GeL; source and binary distributions.

title: IMP Compiler
desc: - For Imp-77 language on Intel x86 processors, an ALGOL-like high-level language originally designed as the implementation language of the Edinburgh Multi-Access System, developed at Edinburgh University.

title: Inger
desc: - A simple imperative programming language. Description and compiler download. [Open source, GPL]

title: Leopard
desc: - A programming language created solely for beginners.

title: MCPL
desc: - a simple typeless language which is based on BCPL. It makes  use of pattern matching somewhat related to that used in ML and Prolog. Some other features come from C.

title: PILOT
desc: - Simple interpreted language designed for use in computer-assisted instruction (CAI), 3 implementations, IEEE-standard and open source version exist.

title: Profan2
desc: - Full language with scripting/batch abilities, database development system, built-in ODBC interface, interpreter and compiler. For Windows, common in Germany, easy to make English version. English page on website. [freeware (early version), commercial]

title: Quikcode
desc: - Free PC implementation of easy, yet powerful procedural IBM mainframe programming language Quikjob. Some uses: scanning files, making reports and quick utilities, converting files. For DOS 5.0 and up, Windows 3.1/95/98, Linux, Stratus VOS.

title: SQR-info.com
desc: - SQR is a reporting and database access language. Links to resources and technical information.

title: UniCOMAL
desc: - The site supplies and supports MacharSoft version of the COMAL programming language. It's classic imperative interpreted language, similar to BASIC but with a wider range of structures and facilities.

title: XPL
desc: - Language and compiler generator system (or TWS: translator writing system) based on language. Derived from PL/I with its syntax, but structure close to C, first release 1968. Descriptions, book, port list, resources, publications list.

title: Andreas Kupries: Compiled and Interpreted languages
desc: - Treats the meaning of interpretation, with definitions.

title: Ch
desc: - A C-like language interpreter with C++-like classes. By SoftIntegration.

title: A++

title: Alice.org

title: SGP Systems
desc: - Makes Baltie line of educational, graphic, object-oriented visual languages, for kids through adults; DOS and Windows versions. Czech Republic.

title: Zngr L
desc: - Compiler of the theoretical language L, which   is used as a simple language for teaching computation theory

title: Computers: Programming: Languages: Comparison and Review
Afnix Programming Language
desc: - A multi-threaded functional programming language with dynamic symbol bindings which provides a state of art runtime engine for 32- and 64-bit platform and a rich set of platform independent libraries, compatible with C++ runtime operations, automatic protection engine for shared objects. Successor of Aleph.

title: The Agda Wiki
desc: - Home page for the Agda 2, a dependently typed functional programming language.

title: Aldor

title: Acute
desc: - Experimental high-level language for distributed computing, focus: typing, naming, version change; designed, formally specified, implemented; extends OCaml core to support distributed development, deployment, execution, type-safe interaction between separately-built programs.

title: Charm++
desc: - An object-oriented portable parallel language built on top of C++.  Source code, binaries, manuals, and publications.

title: The Cilk Project
desc: - A language for multithreaded parallel programming based on ANSI C. Source code, manual, papers, and research into parallel chess programs.

title: CDuce
desc: - An XML centric programming language with higher order, semantic subtyping, pattern matching and overloading, and open source implementation.

title: Charity

title: Disclojure

title: Eden

title: FAQ for comp.lang.functional
desc: - Offers  documentation as a frequently asked questions list.  Also provides links to general topic, technical and other resources.

title: Functional Programming
desc: - Claus Reinke's , well organized bookmarks on FP.

title: JavaParty

title: Mentat
desc: - Object-oriented parallel language based on C++.  Documentation, source code and binaries, and sample programs.

title: NESL
desc: - A functional parallel language.  Tutorial, source code, algorithm library, animations, and reference manual.

title: Parallaxis-III

title: PARLANSE

title: The SR Programming Language

desc: - Community site: projects, news, FAQ, documents, publications, tutorials, forum, mail list, work groups, events, downloads.

desc: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

title: Links: Linking Theory to Practice for the Web
desc: - Functional language to solve impedance mismatch problem by using one language for all 3 tiers of web programming: front-end browser, middle-tier server, back-end database; people, mail lists, papers, talks, wiki, downloads.

title: Unified Parallel C: UPC

title: Z++

title: ZPL
desc: - An array programming language.  Sample code, papers, recipes, reference manual, and source code.

title: Declarative Ada: parallel dataflow programming in a familiar context
desc: - From Proceedings of the 1995 ACM 23rd annual conference on Computer science conference.

title: Pure Data (PD)
desc: - Real-time graphical dataflow programming environment for audio, video, and graphical processing.

desc: - Resource-bounded functional language that uses a form of remote procedure call to realize active networking. Part of the SwitchWare Project. Descriptions, documents, downloads, contacts, links.

title: Q Equational Programming Language
desc: - An extensible functional programming language based on the term rewriting calculus.

title: Readscheme.org - Resources for Functional Programming
desc: - A variety of research resources on functional programming languages, implementation, and applications of functional programming languages.

title: Scala Programming Language
desc: - General purpose programming language designed to express common programming patterns in a concise, elegant, and type-safe way.

title: Tutorial Papers in Functional Programming
desc: - John Hughes' list of FP-related tutorials and courses.

title: The Unlambda Programming Language
desc: - A functional language designed for obscurity

title: Wadler: Monads
desc: - Information on monads and functional programming

title: What the Hell are Monads?
desc: - Basic introduction to monads, monadic programming, and I/O.

title: Whiley
desc: - A hybrid object-oriented and functional programming language which compiles to the JVM.

title: Why Functional Programming Matters
desc: - A paper by John Hughes from 1984 along with some translations distributed on the author web site.

title: Wikipedia: Functional Programming
desc: - Encyclopdia article including a definition, comparison, history, and examples.

desc:
- Brief article, explains what they are, and how and why their popularity is growing; with links and reader comments. Linux Journal.
                                 (April 30, 2007)

desc: - Wiki page, with pros, cons, comments, links, at Cunningham and Cunningham, Inc.

title: Memory Management
desc: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

desc: - Definition and answer with references, from Object-Orientation FAQ.

desc: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

desc: - Language and set of technologies providing a full alternative to data access and manipulation abilities of .NET; full foundation for Automated Application Development (AAD).

Declarative Programming Language
desc: - Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

Constraints Archive
desc: - Holds comp.constraints FAQ, pages of constraint-related pointers, source code for various systems, benchmarks, directory of people interested in constraints, constraint bibliographies, collection of online papers,  links. Clearly the product of much work.

desc: - Description of book, Academic Press, release 1993: programs from book.

title: Book: Programming with Constraints: an Introduction
desc: - Description of book, MIT Press, release March 1998: programs from book, slides for courses for use with book.

title: Brandeis Interval Arithmetic Constraint Solver
desc: - Java applet that solves non-linear real arithmetic constraints.

title: Constraints for the Web
desc: - Constraints can specify desired layout of web documents, and behavior of embedded applets: 2 system architectures where author and viewer can make layout constraints, needed and optional. Final appearance of page comes from negotiation between author and viewer, via solving all the constraints.

title: Constraints: An International Journal
desc: - Covering all aspects of computing with constraints; on paper or online; fee required.

title: DeltaBlue Code Archive
desc: - For incremental dataflow constraint solver, implemented in varied languages, each in a subdirectory named after the language: C DEC, C SUN4; Common Lisp, Smalltalk.

title: DeltaBlue Constraint Solver
desc: - Efficient, incremental local propagation constraint solver. Like most local propagation algorithms, it cannot  accommodate cyclic constraints. University of Washington site.

title: A Differential Approach to Graphical Interaction
desc: - The ad hoc manner in which direct manipulation interfaces have been designed and implemented restricts the types of interactive controls. This dissertation presents a new approach for a systematic method to implement flexible, combinable interactive controls.

title: E-constraints.net
desc: - Home of Explanation-based Constraint Programming. Definitions, applications, libraries, links.

title: Garnet Project
desc: - Generating an Amalgam of Real-time, Novel Editors and Toolkits; developed by User Interface Software Group, Human Computer Interaction Institute, School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon University. Free: public domain.

title: Garnet: Brad A. Myers
desc: - Personal page of Garnet inventor and lead researcher. Describes Garnet motives, rationale.

title: Garnet: Multi-Garnet: Integrating Multi-Way Constraints with Garnet
desc: - ResearchIndex: Constraints provide a useful mechanism to maintain relations in user interface toolkits. Garnet is a widely used user interface toolkit with high functionality, based on one way, required constraints. Multi-Garnet extends this by adding support for multi-way constraints and hierarchies.

title: Gecode
desc: - Generic Constraint Development Environment. Constraint solver implemented as C++ library. Main goals: modifiability, extensibility, speed. Features: integer and set variables, large constraint set, copying-based search. [Open Source, BSD]

title: Guide to Constraint Programming
desc: - Online tutorial/textbook for beginners to the area of constraint programming. This area is of the set of less known software technologies, but is evolving rapidly and has a growing, significant commercial interest.

title: ICOT Free Software
desc: - Free constraint software developed by Institute for New Generation Computer Technology (ICOT), Japan: Constraint MGTP (CMGTP) model generation theorem prover (MGTP), MGTP-G, KLIC, some cu-Prologs, and documents. FTP site.

title: ILOG CP
desc: - Constraint-programming optimization engine, providing cutting-edge optimization technology and an optimization library for workforce scheduling, league scheduling, sequencing, configuration, dispatching and resource-allocation applications with logical constraints.

title: Canonware Onyx
desc: - Stack-based (are first class objects, double-ended), object-oriented, multithreaded (POSIX), interpreted, garbage collected, general purpose, similar to PostScript; embedable as extension language. Downloads, documents. Open source, BSD.

title: Factor
desc: - Dynamically typed, stack-based language; has optimizing native compiler, automatic memory management, generational garbage collector, collections library, advanced features: higher-order programming, continuations, extensible syntax.

title: Wikipedia: Data-structured Language
desc: - Online encyclopedia article providing an overview of this type of programming language.

title: MAC and Combined Heuristics: Two Reasons to Forsake FC (and CBJ?) on Hard Problems
desc: - ResearchIndex: In the last 20 years, many algorithms and heuristics were developed to find solutions in constraint networks. Their number increased so much that it quickly became vital to compare performance to propose a small number of good methods.

title: Natural Programming
desc: - Attempt to make a system that is easier to learn and use than anything available to novice programmers today: HANDS: Human-centered Advances for Novice Development of Software. School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon University; NSF funded.

title: Omega Project
desc: - Frameworks and algorithms for analyzing and transforming scientific programs; 2 major components: the Omega test system to manipulate sets of affine constraints over integer variables; and developing frameworks to analyze and transform programs.

title: ResearchIndex: Kaleidoscope: A Constraint Imperative Programming Language

title: Seventh International Conference on Principles and Practice of Constraint Programming
StarFLIP++
desc: - Free, reusable iterative optimization library for combinatorial problems with fuzzy constraints. GNU LGPL.

title: ThingLabII: Constraint-based user interfaces
desc: - Supports exploration of constraint-based user interfaces; consists of a set of classes that define constraints and constrainable objects called things. Incremental constraint satisfier, module compiler, construction-set style user interface, many tools, extensible set of primitive user interface building blocks.

title: The Alef Concurrent Programming Language
desc: - Papers describing Plan 9's Alef programming language by Phil Winterbottom.

title: Bell Labs and CSP Threads
desc: - Resources about threaded programming in the Bell Labs CSP style, by Russ Cox: history, principles and style of concurrent programming practiced at Bell Labs.

title: ChucK
desc: - Concurrent, time-based, on-the-fly, audio programming language, supports precise, fundamental level of expressiveness, multiple, simultaneous, dynamic control rates, ability to add, remove, modify code as programs run.

title: Cilk Project
desc: - Concurrent language for parallel programming based on ANSI C. Source code, manual, papers and research into parallel chess programs.

title: Comega: Cω
desc: - C# extension, in two areas: Control flow extension for asynchronous wide area concurrency (was Polyphonic C#); Data type extension for XML and table manipulation (was Xen and X#).

title: Communicating Sequential Processes
desc: - CSP is a language for describing patterns of interaction. A book by Tony Hoare introducing the language and the mathematical theory behind it is available in PDF format.

title: Esterel
desc: - One of a family of synchronous languages which are particularly well-suited to programming reactive systems, including real-time systems and control automata.

title: FT Languages Page
desc: - Fault-tolerant projects, goal: enhance language support for distributed programs with FT needs, most high-level languages lack good support for such, more so at system level; 3 projects described, FT-SR, FT-Linda, FTAG.

title: The Go Programming Language
desc: - Documentation, source, and other resources for Google's Go language.

title: Go Programming Language Resources
desc: - Documentation, syntax highlighting files for various editors and IDEs, links to Go libraries and bindings to C libraries, etc.

title: Joule
desc: - The Joule system is a foundation for building distributed applications. Joule Quick Reference 1.0 and The Joule Manual, divided into chapters as PDF files.

title: Libtask
desc: - A coroutine library for C and Unix.

title: Linda
desc: - Simple library implementation of the Linda parallel programming system. SourceForge project page: downloads, forum and CVS.

title: LoI (Language of Interaction)
desc: - Designed to support interaction-oriented programming. This paradigm is especially suitable for the design of reactive component-based systems like distributed and interactive systems.

title: MC#
desc: - MC# (Multiprocessor C#) is a high-level object-oriented language based on .NET platform made for developing complex industrial program systems that can use multiprocessors.

title: NesC
desc: - A language for Deeply Networked Systems, implemented as a C extension based on structuring concepts and execution model of TinyOS, an event-driven OS for sensor network nodes with very limited resources: 8K bytes program memory, 512 bytes RAM.

title: Petri Nets World
desc: - Petri Nets is a formal and graphical appealing language which is appropriate for modelling systems with concurrency.

title: Computers: Programming: Languages: Comparison and Review
Computer Languages History
desc: - Timeline chart, 1954 to today, printable; links to homes of many languages.

title: Diagram of Languages
desc: - Two diagrams showing how many languages are related to each other.

title: Historic Documents in Computer Science
desc: - Original, historic first documents for many early programming languages, like language manualsa, scanned and converted to PDF form.

title: History and Comparison of Programming Languages
desc: - Papers on use history of: comments, labels, literals, parentheses.

title: O'Reilly: The History of Programming Languages
desc: - A poster plots over 50 programming languages on a multi-layered, color-coded timeline.

title: The Retrocomputing Museum
desc: - Dedicated to programs that induce sensations that hover somewhere between nostalgia and nausea. The freaks, jokes, and fossils of computing history.

title: Wikipedia: PL/I
desc: - An encyclopedia description of PL/I history with many links to programming terms.

Dictionary of Programming Languages
